body_html: On the 'async' identifier issue that @ezyang brings up above, I think we should change it to match whatever we do in python. I personally prefer an indication that this may be async (since we don't do async for cpu-to-cpu copies for example). Something like maybeAsync, but I understand if people think that is too verbose.
body_text: On the 'async' identifier issue that @ezyang brings up above, I think we should change it to match whatever we do in python.  I personally prefer an indication that this may be async (since we don't do async for cpu-to-cpu copies for example).  Something like maybeAsync, but I understand if people think that is too verbose.
body: On the 'async' identifier issue that @ezyang brings up above, I think we should change it to match whatever we do in python.  I personally prefer an indication that this _may_ be async (since we don't do async for cpu-to-cpu copies for example).  Something like maybeAsync, but I understand if people think that is too verbose.
